results.title: Photography in science
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Photography: an introduction”.
Overviews the wide variety of applications for scientific photography from providing legal evidence to diagnosing diseases. It is used to document, measure, reveal and communicate. Advances in computer and digital technology are revolutionising scientific photography and some of these changes are explained.

results.title: Photography around us
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Photography: an introduction”.
Offers an introduction to the history of photography in Australia and its gradual acceptance as an artform by museums and educational institutions. Local authorities in the field discuss changing attitudes to photography. In particular Sue Fereday, Director of the Centre for Contemporary Photography, and Isobel Crombie, Curator of Photography at the National Gallery of Victoria explain their policies towards collecting and exhibiting photography.

results.title: Photographic memory: a portrait of Mervyn Bishop (A)
results.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Penny McDonald and Chili Films
results.brief_description: A documentary about the life and photography of Mervyn Bishop, one of Australia’s leading indigenous professional photographers who broke new ground during the 1960’s and 1970’s as a media photographer. Bishop’s extensive archive of photographs offer an invaluable document of aspects of Australian and Aboriginal life over the past 40 years.

results.title: Photographic design
results.brief_description: Host Brian Ratty explains and illustrates many tips about photographic design. He covers selecting the right tools, visualizing the best composition, and designing with light and colour.

results.title: Photographers of Australia: Dupain, Sievers, Moore
results.creator_credit: Gregory Read, Wolfgang Knochell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Since the arrival of the camera in Australia in the mid 19th Century, it has recorded the nation’s life. This is the story of some of the most enduring images of the Australian experience and the three men who made them - Max Dupain, Wolfgang Sievers and David Moore. Relive the history of Australia, from the 1930s to the present day through the lenses of these renowned photographers.

results.title: Photoelectric effect
results.creator_credit: Gene Kearney and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description: Presents qualitative demonstrations of photo-electric effect employing the sun and a carbon arc as sources. Also shows an experiment measuring the kinetic energy of the photoelectrons emitted from a potassium surface.
